Provision.Text: Whereas a provision of the annexed Regulations deals with the communication of information obtained under the Regulations to certain classes of persons, and in the opinion of the Governor in Council, pursuant to paragraph 55(1)(s) of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Acta, it is necessary to communicate the information to those classes of persons for the proper administration of the Act and the Regulations;

Therefore, Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Health, pursuant to subsection 55(1) of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Acta, hereby makes the annexed Precursor Control Regulations.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act. (Loi)
Class A export permit means a permit to export one or more Class A precursors, issued under section 33. (permis d’exportation de catégorie A)
Class A import permit means a permit to import one or more Class A precursors, issued under section 26. (permis d’importation de catégorie A)
Class A precursor means,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any substance set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any preparation or mixture referred to in Part 3 of Schedule VI to the Act that contains a substance referred to in paragraph (a). (précurseur de catégorie A)

Definition.Text: Class B export permit means a permit to export one or more Class B precursors, issued under section 70. (permis d’exportation de catégorie B)
Class B precursor means,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any substance set out in Part 2 of Schedule VI to the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any preparation or mixture referred to in Part 3 of Schedule VI to the Act that contains a substance referred to in paragraph (a). (précurseur de catégorie B)

Definition.Text: competent authority means a public authority of a foreign country that is authorized under the laws of the country to approve the importation or exportation of precursors into or from the country. (autorité compétente)
customs officer means an officer as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Customs Act. (agent des douanes)
designated criminal offence means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any offence involving the financing of terrorism against sections 83.02 to 83.04 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any offence involving fraud against sections 380 to 382 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the offence of laundering proceeds of crime against section 462.31 of the Criminal Code;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an offence involving organized crime against sections 467.11 to 467.13 of the Criminal Code; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in paragraphs (a) to (e). (infraction désignée en matière criminelle)

Definition.Text: designated drug offence means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence against section 39, 44.2, 44.3, 48, 50.2 or 50.3 of the Food and Drugs Act, as those provisions read immediately before May 14, 1997;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an offence against section 4, 5, 6, 19.1 or 19.2 of the Narcotic Control Act, as those provisions read immediately before May 14, 1997;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an offence under Part I of the Act, except subsection 4(1), and an offence against section 46 of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a conspiracy or an attempt to commit, being an accessory after the fact in relation to, or any counselling in relation to, an offence referred to in paragraphs (a) to (c). (infraction désignée en matière de drogue)

Definition.Text: drug in dosage form means a drug in a form that is ready for use by the consumer without requiring any further manufacturing. (drogue sous forme posologique)
extract means, in respect of a precursor, to isolate the precursor from a preparation or mixture by any physical or chemical process including distillation. (extraire)

Harmonized System Code means, in respect of goods, the numeric identifier set out for those goods in the Harmonized Commodity Description and Coding System published by the World Customs Organization. (numéro de code du système harmonisé)
hospital means a facility that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is licensed, approved or designated as a hospital by a province under the laws of the province to provide health care or treatment to persons or animals; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is owned or operated by the Government of Canada or a province and that provides health services. (hôpital)

Definition.Text: INCB means the International Narcotics Control Board. (OICS)

internal controls means, in respect of an undertaking conducting activities pertaining to a precursor, the internal processes and procedures used by the undertaking to assist in achieving the objective that, to the extent practical, it has reliable information about its precursor activities governed by these Regulations. (contrôles internes)

international obligation means an obligation in respect of a controlled substance or a precursor set out in a convention, treaty or other multilateral or bilateral instrument that Canada has ratified or to which Canada adheres. (obligation internationale)
licence means a licence issued to a licensed dealer under section 16. (licence)
licensed dealer means the holder of a licence. (distributeur autorisé)
peace officer means a peace officer as defined in section 2 of the Criminal Code. (agent de la paix)
pharmacist means an individual who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is registered or otherwise authorized under the laws of a province to practise pharmacy; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is practising pharmacy in that province. (pharmacien)

Definition.Text: prescription means, in respect of a preparation or mixture containing a Class A precursor, an authorization from a practitioner stating that a specific amount of the preparation or mixture may be sold or provided for the individual or animal under the practitioner’s care named in the authorization. (ordonnance)
produce means, in respect of a precursor, to obtain the precursor by any method or process, including

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: manufacturing, synthesizing or using any means of altering the chemical or physical properties of the precursor, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cultivating, propagating or harvesting the precursor or any living thing from which the precursor may be isolated or otherwise obtained

Definition.Text: registered dealer means the holder of a registration certificate. (distributeur inscrit)
registration means registration by the Minister under section 62. (inscription)
registration certificate means a certificate issued under section 62. (certificat d’inscription)

responsible person in charge means the individual designated under subsection 13(2) having responsibility for the supervision of activities carried out at the licensed site by the licensed dealer under their licence. (personne responsable)
retail means a sale or provision of goods for the purpose of end-use but not resale. (au détail)
senior person in charge means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a licensed dealer, the individual designated under subsection 13(1) to have overall responsibility for management of the licensed dealer’s Class A precursor activities at the licensed site; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a registered dealer, the individual designated under subsection 59(1) to have overall responsibility for management of the registered dealer’s Class B precursor activities (responsable principal)

Definition.Text: site means, in respect of a licensed dealer or a registered dealer carrying on one or more activities mentioned in section 6 or 57, respectively,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a building or place in a building used by the licensed dealer or registered dealer; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an area occupied exclusively by buildings used by the licensed dealer or registered dealer. (installation)

Definition.Text: transhipment means, in respect of a Class A precursor that has been unloaded or in any way removed from the means of transportation by which it came into Canada, its loading or placing on board or within or on the same or any other means of transportation used for its departure from Canada. (transbordement)

Section.Text: With respect to a drug in dosage form, a person who sells or provides or possesses for the purpose of sale or provision, or who conducts an activity mentioned in section 9 or 47, is exempt from the requirements of these Regulations in respect of that activity if the drug contains

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a Class A precursor that is a prescription drug as defined in section A.01.010 of the Food and Drug Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a Class A precursor and one or more controlled substances listed in Schedule I, III or IV to the Act.

Section.Text: With respect to a Class A precursor that is a preparation or mixture, a person who conducts an activity mentioned in section 6, 9, 10 or 47 is exempt from the requirements of these Regulations, except requirements in respect of the production of the preparation or mixture or the possession of a precursor for the purpose of producing the preparation or mixture, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the preparation or mixture is a fragrance or flavouring

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: containing anthranilic acid, N-anthranilic acid, gamma butyrolactone, phenylacetic acid, piperonal or piperidine in a total concentration equal to or less than 20% by weight or volume in the case of a solid or liquid, respectively, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: intended to be used in a food, drug, cosmetic or household product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is a silicone product that is a sealant, adhesive or coating containing acetic anhydride in a concentration equal to or less than 1% by weight or volume in the case of a solid or liquid, respectively; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it contains gamma butyrolactone or 1,4-butanediol in a total concentration equal to or less than 20% by weight or volume in the case of a solid or liquid respectively, and is intended to be used in the following products or processes:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a control product as defined in the Pest Control Products Act, R.S., c. P-9, before the coming into force of subsection 2(1) of the Pest Control Products Act, S.C. 2002, c. 28,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a pest control product as defined in the Pest Control Products Act, S.C. 2002, c. 28, after the coming into force of subsection 2(1) of that Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: cleaning or etching preparations for electronic devices, components and parts,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: biofermentation for polyester production,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: melamine coatings,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: automotive coatings, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: resin systems for manufacturing polyurethane.

Subsection.Text: A person who uses a Class A precursor that is described in section 3 or is the subject of an authorization certificate under section 49, to produce another Class A precursor that is a preparation or mixture, is exempt from the requirements of these Regulations in respect of that production.

With respect to a preparation or mixture produced under subsection (1), a person who conducts any activity mentioned in section 6, 9, 10 or 47 is exempt from the requirements of these Regulations in respect of the activity.

Section.Text: With respect to any Class A precursor, a person who only sells, provides or possesses for the purpose of sale or provision is exempt from the requirements of these Regulations in respect of the activity if the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sells or provides a selection of goods that is not limited to chemicals or chemicals and equipment used in the chemical industry for the production, processing or storage of chemicals; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sells or provides Class A precursors

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: only on a retail basis,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a precursor set out in column 1 of the schedule, only in a quantity, per transaction, that does not exceed the maximum quantity, expressed as an absolute amount or per package, specified for the precursor in column 2 of the schedule, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a preparation or mixture containing a precursor set out in column 1 of the schedule, only in a quantity, per transaction, that does not exceed the maximum quantity, expressed as an absolute quantity or per package, specified for the contained precursor in column 2 of the schedule.

Subsection.Text: No person other than a licensed dealer may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: produce a Class A precursor;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: package a Class A precursor; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sell or provide a Class A precursor.

Subsection.Text: No person may possess a Class A precursor for the purpose of an activity mentioned in subsection (1), except to the extent necessary to conduct the activity in relation to the precursor, as authorized by the person’s licence.
A licensed dealer may import or export a Class A precursor or possess a Class A precursor for the purpose of export if the dealer complies with the conditions set out in section 7.

Section.Text: No person may possess a Class A precursor for the purpose of producing a controlled substance unless the person is the holder of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a licence issued under section G.02.003.2 or J.01.007.2 of the Food and Drug Regulations, section 21 of the Benzodiazepines and Other Targeted Substances Regulations or section 9.2 of the Narcotic Control Regulations that authorizes the production of the substance; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an exemption issued under section 56 of the Act.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer may carry out an activity referred to in section 6 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer is licensed to carry out the activity with respect to the Class A precursor;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer carries out the activity in accordance with all conditions set out in the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of import, the licensed dealer is the holder of a Class A import permit for the precursor and acts in accordance with all conditions set out in the permit; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of export, the licensed dealer is the holder of a Class A export permit for the precursor and acts in accordance with all conditions set out in the permit.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer who intends to sell or provide, to a person who is not a licensed dealer, a Class A precursor set out in column 1 of the schedule in a quantity, per transaction, greater than the maximum quantity, expressed as an absolute quantity or per package, specified for the precursor in column 2 of the schedule shall, before entering into the transaction, obtain an end-use declaration signed and dated by the person acquiring the precursor.
The end-use declaration shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the licensed dealer, being, in the case of a corporation, its corporate name, as well as their address and telephone number and facsimile transmission number, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person acquiring the precursor, being, in the case of a corporation, its corporate name, as well as their address and telephone number and facsimile transmission number, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of all Class A precursors involved in the transactions mentioned in the end-use declaration;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: all uses for which the precursor is being acquired; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a certification by the signatory stating that the person is acquiring the precursor as the end user, for the uses mentioned in the end-use declaration.

Subsection.Text: If a licensed dealer intends to sell or provide, to a person who is not a licensed dealer, a Class A precursor that is a preparation or mixture containing a precursor set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act, an end-use declaration under subsection (1) is required if the quantity of the contained precursor, per transaction, is greater than the maximum quantity, expressed as an absolute quantity or per package, specified for the contained precursor in column 2 of the schedule.

An end-use declaration obtained under subsection (1) or (2) applies to any subsequent transaction between the licensed dealer and the signatory to the declaration that occurs in the same calendar year as the transaction mentioned in the declaration if the subsequent transaction involves the same Class A precursor and the same end-uses.

For greater certainty, another end-use declaration must be obtained in respect of a subsequent transaction between the licensed dealer and the signatory to the declaration that occurs in the same calendar year as the transaction mentioned in the declaration if the transaction involves a different Class A precursor or a different end-use.

A licensed dealer required to obtain an end-use declaration must take reasonable steps to verify the identity of the signatory to the declaration if that person or their signature is unfamiliar to the licensed dealer.
No person may send, transport or deliver a Class A precursor, or possess the precursor for such a purpose, except

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a licensed dealer, to the extent necessary to conduct an activity permitted by the licence in respect of the precursor;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an agent or mandatary of the licensed dealer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the end user of the precursor; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an agent or mandatary of the end user.

Subsection.Text: A person sending, transporting or delivering a Class A precursor set out in column 1 of the schedule in a quantity greater than the maximum quantity, expressed as an absolute quantity or per package, specified for the precursor in column 2 of the schedule, shall ensure that the precursor is accompanied by documentation indicating

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of the precursor;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the licensed dealer selling or providing the precursor;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person to whom the precursor is being sent, transported or delivered; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date the precursor was sent.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must, when transporting an imported Class A precursor between the port of entry and the site set out in the licence, or when sending, delivering or transporting a Class A precursor to a destination, including the port of exit, take all steps necessary to ensure the safekeeping of the precursor during transportation or ensure that all steps are taken so as to prevent the diversion of the precursor to an illicit market or use.

Section.Text: If a rail car, reusable container, intermodal tank container or other container, having a capacity of 9,000 L or more, was used to provide or send red or white phosphorus and the rail car or container is returned to the person who produced the phosphorous with residual amounts that cannot be offloaded under normally accepted operating procedures in the chemical industry, the person returning the rail car or container in that state is exempt from the requirements of these Regulations in respect of that activity.

A person shall not transport a Class A precursor in transit through Canada or tranship a Class A precursor in Canada that is coming from one country and going to another or possess a Class A precursor for either of those purposes except in accordance with a permit issued under section 40.

Despite sections 6 to 10 and 47, with respect to a Class A precursor that is a preparation or mixture, a person may sell, provide, send, transport, deliver, import, export, transport in transit through Canada, tranship in Canada, destroy or possess for those purposes if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the preparation or mixture is the subject of an authorization certificate under section 49; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no notice indicating that the certificate has been revoked or is under suspension appears on the following Health Canada Internet site:

Subsection.Text: An individual entering or returning to Canada and having in their possession a Class A precursor that is a preparation or mixture may import the preparation or mixture if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the preparation or mixture is intended to treat a medical condition of the individual or an accompanying person for whom the individual is responsible;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a preparation or mixture containing ephedra, ephedrine or pseudoephedrine, the preparation or mixture is packaged and labelled as a consumer product and the total quantity imported of the precursor contained in the preparation or mixture does not exceed

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of ephedra, 20 g,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of ephedrine, 0.4 g, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of pseudoephedrine, 3 g; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a preparation or mixture containing ergometrine or ergotamine, the preparation or mixture is packaged in a container with a label showing that it was dispensed under prescription in a pharmacy or hospital or by a physician and the total quantity imported of the precursor contained in the preparation or mixture does not exceed the lesser of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a single prescribed course of treatment, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a 90-day supply, based on the normal daily dose for the precursor.

Subsection.Text: An individual leaving Canada and having in their possession a Class A precursor that is a preparation or mixture may export the preparation or mixture if the requirements of subsection (1) are met, with any modifications that the circumstances require.

Section.Text: To be eligible to apply for a licence, a person must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who ordinarily resides in Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a corporation that has its head office or a branch office in Canada.

Heading.TitleText: Senior Person in Charge and Responsible Person in Charge

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must designate a senior person in charge, who may, if appropriate, be the licensed dealer, to have overall responsibility for management of the licensed dealer’s Class A precursor activities at the licensed site.

A licensed dealer must designate a responsible person in charge, who may, if appropriate, be the senior person in charge, to work at the site set out in the licence and have responsibility for supervising, on behalf of the licensed dealer, the licensed dealer’s Class A precursor activities at the site and for ensuring that the activities comply with these Regulations.

A licensed dealer may designate an alternate responsible person in charge to work at the site set out in the licence and have authority to replace the responsible person in charge when that person is absent.
The senior person in charge, responsible person in charge and the alternate responsible person in charge

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must be familiar with the provisions of the Act and these Regulations that apply to the licence held by the licensed dealer by whom they are designated; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: must not have been convicted, as an adult, within the previous 10 years, of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated drug offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated criminal offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence committed outside of Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii).

Subsection.Text: The responsible person in charge and the alternate responsible person in charge must have sufficient knowledge concerning the use and handling of Class A precursors to which the licence applies, including the risk of those precursors being diverted to an illicit market or use, to enable them to properly perform their responsibilities.
An application for a licence or to renew a licence pertaining to a Class A precursor shall be made to the Minister and contain the following information

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s name or, if the applicant is a corporation, its corporate name, any other registered name with a province and any other trade name under which the applicant intends to carry out the activities set out in the licence or intends to identify itself;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the nature of the business conducted or intended to be conducted by the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (a.2)
Paragraph.Text: the length of time, if any, the applicant has been in business;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for each Class A precursor sought to be licensed,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, if any, otherwise a description of its chemical composition,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a preparation or mixture, its brand name, if any, and the names of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains;

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a drug containing a precursor for which a drug identification number has been assigned under section C.01.014.2 of the Food and Drug Regulations, the drug identification number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a natural health product containing a precursor for which a product number has been assigned under section 8 of the Natural Health Products Regulations, the product number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for each precursor mentioned in the application,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Class A precursor activity referred to in section 6 that is sought to be licensed and that would be conducted at the site to which the licence would apply,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the names of the persons from whom the applicant intends to obtain the precursor, if applicable, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of clientele to whom the applicant intends to supply the precursor;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: if an establishment licence under section C.01A.008 of the Food and Drug Regulations has been issued to the applicant in respect of a Class A precursor, the number of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (c.2)
Paragraph.Text: if a site licence under section 29 or 36 of the Natural Health Products Regulations has been issued to the applicant in respect of a Class A precursor, the number of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the address, telephone number, facsimile transmission number and e-mail address of the site sought to be licensed and each building within the site where the activity sought to be licensed is to be carried out;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the postal address for the site and each building referred to in paragraph (d), if different from the address provided under that paragraph;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name, date of birth, gender, position with the applicant, telephone number, facsimile transmission number and e-mail address of the senior person in charge for the site;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the name, date of birth and gender of the responsible person in charge for the site and the alternate responsible person in charge, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the proposed security measures to be used at the site and when a precursor is transported, sent or delivered, including the measures required under subsection 9(2), section 83 and subsection 85(3);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the internal controls proposed with respect to precursor activities at the site; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an application to renew, the number of the licence sought to be renewed.

Subsection.Text: If the applicant intends to engage in an activity referred to in section 6 respecting Class A precursors at more than one site, a separate application must be made for each site.
The application for a licence or its renewal must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the senior person in charge for the site mentioned in the application; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information and documents provided in the application are correct and complete to the best of the knowledge of the signatory, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the signatory has the authority to bind the applicant.

Subsection.Text: An application for a licence or its renewal must be accompanied by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: declarations signed by the senior person in charge, the responsible person in charge and the alternate responsible person in charge, if any, stating that they have not, as an adult, been convicted within the previous 10 years of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated drug offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated criminal offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence committed outside of Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a document issued by a Canadian police force with respect to each of the persons referred to in paragraph (a), setting out the person’s criminal record for the previous 10 years, as an adult, in respect of designated drug offences and designated criminal offences, or indicating that the person has no such record;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if any of the persons mentioned in paragraph (a) has ordinarily resided in a country other than Canada in the preceding 10 years, a document issued by a police force of that country setting out the person’s criminal record for the previous 10 years, as an adult, in respect of an offence that would have constituted a designated criminal offence or a designated drug offence if committed in Canada, or indicating that the person has no such record; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, a copy of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the certificate of incorporation or other constituting instrument for the applicant, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any document filed with the province in which the site sought to be licensed is located that states the applicant’s corporate name and any other name registered with the province under which the applicant will carry out the activities set out in the licence or will identify itself.

Subsection.Text: The documents referred to in paragraphs (4)(b) and (c) are not required if the persons referred to in those paragraphs consent in writing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to having a criminal record check carried out for them, as an adult, in respect of the offences mentioned in those paragraphs during the preceding 10 years;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to provide all information and to submit to any means of identification required to obtain the criminal record check; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to pay the fee established by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, Criminal Record Verification for Civil Purposes Fee Regulations.

Section.Text: The Minister may, on receiving an application made under this Part, require the submission of any additional information that pertains to the information contained in the application and that is necessary for the Minister to process the application.
The Minister may, in respect of an applicant or a licensed dealer, at any reasonable time,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: require the inspection of the site used or intended to be used in producing, packaging, selling or providing a Class A precursor or to or from which a Class A precursor has been or is to be imported or exported;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: examine, as part of the inspection, the security measures used or put in place at the site and in respect of the sending, transportation or delivery of precursors;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: examine, as part of the inspection, the internal controls used or put in place at the site with respect to precursor activities; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: examine, as part of the inspection, the books, registers, electronic data and other records held or put in place in accordance with section 85.

Section.Text: Subject to section 17, if the requirements of section 14 are met, the Minister shall issue or renew a licence that indicates

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the licensed dealer or, if the applicant is a corporation, their corporate name;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the names of all Class A precursors to which the licence applies;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for each precursor to which the licence applies, the Class A precursor activities authorized by the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the address of the licensed site where the authorized activities are to be conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry of the licence, which may not be later than three years after the effective date; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that the international obligations of Canada are respected, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure compliance with the Act and these Regulations, including reducing the risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister shall, in accordance with subsection 84(1), refuse to issue, renew or amend a licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant is not eligible under section 12;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that any information or document included in the application is false or misleading;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: additional information required under section 15 has not been provided or is insufficient to enable the Minister to process the application;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the issuance, renewal or amendment of the licence would permit an activity that would not be in compliance with an international obligation of Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority, the United Nations or a peace officer raises a reasonable belief that the applicant has been or will be involved in the diversion of a controlled substance or precursor to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not have in place the security measures required under subsection 9(2), section 83 and subsection 85(3) with respect to the precursors sought to be licensed;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant is not, or within the previous 10 years has not been, in compliance with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act or any regulation made or continued under the Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence, registration or import or export permit issued to the applicant under any regulation made or continued under the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the senior person in charge for the site, the responsible person in charge or the alternate responsible person in charge, if any, has been convicted, as an adult, within the previous 10 years, of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated drug offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated criminal offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence committed outside of Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed internal controls referred to in paragraph 14(1)(i) are not sufficient to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: support a reliable system of record-keeping in respect of Class A precursor activities and Class A precursor inventory at the site, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: permit the Minister to audit these precursor activities; or

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the issuance, renewal or amendment of the licence would likely create a risk to public health, safety or security, including the risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister is not required to refuse to issue, renew or amend a licence under paragraph (1)(b) or (g) if the applicant

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act and any regulation made or continued under the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, specified corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act and these Regulations.

Section.Text: A licence is valid until the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the suspension or revocation of the licence under section 22, 23 or 24.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer proposing to amend the information on their licence shall provide the following documents to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an application in writing describing the proposed amendment, accompanied by any supporting documents mentioned in section 14 that are relevant to the proposed amendment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the original licence.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the senior person in charge for the site; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement that the information and documents provided in the application are correct and complete to the best of the knowledge of the signatory.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 17, if the application complies with subsections (1) and (2), the Minister shall amend the licence accordingly and may add any condition necessary to ensure

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that the international obligations of Canada are respected, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: compliance with the Act and these Regulations, including reducing the risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer must obtain the Minister’s approval before

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: designating a replacement for the senior person in charge;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: designating a replacement for either the responsible person in charge or the alternate responsible person in charge, or designating an individual to be the alternate responsible person in charge;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: making a change to the security measures used at the site with respect to Class A precursors kept there or described in the licence application under paragraph 14(1)(h) or in a request for approval under this section; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: making a change to the internal controls applicable to the Class A precursor activities conducted at the site, as described in the licence application or a request approved under this section.

Subsection.Text: With a request for approval under paragraph (1)(a) or (b), the licensed dealer must provide the Minister with the following information and documents with respect to the proposed designation:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a replacement designation for the senior person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph 14(1)(f), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the declaration specified in paragraph 14(4)(a) and, subject to subsection 14(5), the documents specified in paragraphs 14(4)(b) and (c); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a replacement designation for either the responsible person in charge or the alternate responsible person in charge, or the designation of an individual to be the alternate responsible person in charge,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information specified in paragraph 14(1)(g), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the declaration specified in paragraph 14(4)(a) and, subject to subsection 14(5), the documents specified in paragraphs 14(4)(b) and (c).

Subsection.Text: When requesting an approval under paragraph (1)(b.1) or (c), the licensed dealer must provide the Minister with the information that permits the Minister to make an evaluation required under paragraphs 17(1)(f) and (i).

If a senior person in charge ceases to act in that capacity due to death or other unforseen circumstance, the licensed dealer may authorize another person who satisfies the requirements of subsection 13(4) to act as the interim senior person in charge until approval is granted by the Minister pursuant to paragraph (1)(a) concerning the designation of a replacement for the senior person in charge.

A licensed dealer shall advise the Minister within 10 days if the senior person in charge, responsible person in charge or alternate responsible person in charge for the site ceases to act in that capacity.

A licensed dealer shall advise the Minister not later than the next business day if the responsible person in charge for the site ceases to act in that capacity and there is no person designated to act in the capacity of alternate responsible person in charge for the site.

Section.Text: The Minister shall revoke a licence at the request of the holder or if the holder informs the Minister that the licence has been lost or stolen.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister shall revoke a licence in accordance with subsection 84(1) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder is no longer an eligible person under section 12;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licence was issued on the basis of false or misleading information or false or falsified documents;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer has failed to comply with a provision of the Act or any regulation under the Act or a term or condition of a licence, a registration or an import or export permit issued under any regulation made or continued under the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it is discovered that the senior person in charge, the responsible person in charge or the alternate responsible person in charge has been convicted, as an adult, within the previous 10 years of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated drug offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated criminal offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence committed outside of Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii); or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority, the United Nations or a peace officer raises a reasonable belief that the licensed dealer has been or will be involved in the diversion of a controlled substance or precursor to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the continuation of the licence would likely create a risk to public health, safety or security, including the risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister is not required to revoke a licence under paragraph (1)(b) or (c) if the licensed dealer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act and any regulation made or continued under the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, specified corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act and these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may revoke a licence if the licensed dealer fails to comply with the decision of the Minister to suspend the licence under section 24 or if the situation giving rise to the suspension is not rectified.

Section.Text: The Minister shall suspend a licence without prior notice if the Minister has reasonable grounds

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health, safety or security; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to suspect that the continuation of the licence presents a risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: To apply for a Class A import permit, a licensed dealer shall make an application to the Minister that contains the following information and statement:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer’s name and address and the number of their licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer’s business registration number assigned by the Minister of National Revenue;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the Class A precursor sought to be imported

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or a description of its chemical composition, as stated in the licence, and Harmonized System Code,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a preparation or mixture, its brand name, if any, and the names of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity sought to be imported, and, if it is a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the exporter from whom the precursor is being obtained and their address in the country of export;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed means of transportation;

Paragraph.Label: (e.1)
Paragraph.Text: the name of any proposed country of transit or transhipment;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the carrier that is proposed to transport the precursor into Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed port of entry into Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed date of entry into Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the proposed customs broker for the licensed dealer, if any; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the licensed dealer consents to the disclosure of information contained in the application to the INCB and the competent authority in the country of export for the purpose of verifying information contained in the application.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the responsible person in charge or the alternate responsible person in charge, if any, for the site to which the Class A precursor will be transported after being released under the Customs Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement that all information set out in the application is correct and complete to the best of the knowledge of the signatory.

Subsection.Text: The application may deal with more than one Class A precursor for the same shipment.
Subject to section 27, if the requirements of section 25 are met, the Minister shall issue to the licensed dealer a Class A import permit that indicates

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs 25(1)(a) to (i);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry, being the earlier of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a date determined by the Minister that is not more than 180 days after the effective date, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the applicant’s licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that the international obligations of Canada are respected, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure compliance with the Act and these Regulations, including reducing the risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: A Class A import permit is valid until the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the permit,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the suspension or revocation under section 22, 23 or 24 of the licence pertaining to the permit, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the suspension or revocation of the permit under section 29, 30 or 31.

Section.Text: The Minister shall refuse to issue a Class A import permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a circumstance described in any of paragraphs 17(1)(b) to (g) and (j), with any modifications that the circumstances require, exists with respect to the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not hold a licence that applies to the Class A precursor sought to be imported or the applicant’s licence will expire before the proposed date of entry to Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has been informed that one of the following applications made by the applicant with regard to the licence pertaining to the Class A precursor sought to be imported is to be refused under section 17, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an application under section 14 to issue or renew the licence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an application under section 19 to amend the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the import shipment to which the permit would apply would contravene the laws of the country of export or any country of transit or transhipment.

Section.Text: The holder of a Class A import permit shall ensure that an official copy of the permit is surrendered to a customs officer at the port of entry at the time of import.

Subsection.Text: Within 15 days after a shipment containing a Class A precursor is released under the Customs Act, the holder of the Class A import permit for the shipment shall provide the Minister with a declaration containing the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the holder and permit number for the shipment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the port of entry into Canada for the shipment;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date the shipment was released under the Customs Act;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the precursor being shipped or a description of its chemical composition, as stated in the permit; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the precursor being shipped and, if it is a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all of the precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains.

Subsection.Text: The declaration must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the responsible person in charge or the alternate responsible person in charge for the licensed site to which the shipment will be transported after being released under the Customs Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement that all information set out in the declaration is correct and complete to the best of the knowledge of the signatory.

Section.Text: The Minister shall revoke a Class A import permit at the request of the holder or if the holder informs the Minister that the permit has been lost or stolen.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister shall revoke a Class A import permit in accordance with subsection 84(1) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a circumstance described in any of paragraphs 23(1)(a) to (f) exists with respect to the licence pertaining to the Class A precursor to be imported; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the permit was issued on the basis of false or misleading information or false or falsified documents.

Subsection.Text: The Minister is not required to revoke a Class A import permit under subsection (1) if the holder of the permit meets the conditions referred to in subsection 23(2).

The Minister may revoke a Class A import permit if the holder fails to comply with the decision of the Minister to suspend the permit under section 31 or if the situation giving rise to the suspension is not rectified.

Section.Text: The Minister shall suspend a Class A import permit without prior notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence pertaining to the Class A precursor sought to be imported has expired or has been suspended or revoked;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health, safety or security;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to suspect that the continuation of the permit presents a risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it is discovered that the import would contravene the laws of the country of export or a country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: To apply for a Class A export permit, a licensed dealer shall make an application to the Minister that contains the following information and statements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer’s name and address and the number of their licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer’s business number assigned by the Minister of National Revenue;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the Class A precursor sought to be exported

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or a description of its chemical composition, as stated in the licence, and Harmonized System Code,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a preparation or mixture, its brand name, if any, and the names of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity sought to be exported, and, if it is a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the importer and their address in the country of final destination;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed means of transportation;

Paragraph.Label: (e.1)
Paragraph.Text: the name of any proposed country of transit or transhipment;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the carrier that is proposed to transport the precursor through the port of exit;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed port of exit from Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed date of export;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the proposed customs broker for the licensed dealer, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a statement by the licensed dealer that to the best of their knowledge the export would not contravene the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the licensed dealer consents to the disclosure of information contained in the application to the INCB and the competent authority in the country of import for the purpose of verifying information contained in the application.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the responsible person in charge or the alternate responsible person in charge, if any, for the site from which the Class A precursor will be transported to the port of exit; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement that all information set out in the application is correct and complete to the best of the knowledge of the signatory.

Subsection.Text: The application may deal with more than one Class A precursor for the same shipment.
Subject to section 34, if the requirements of section 32 are met, the Minister shall issue to the licensed dealer a Class A export permit that indicates

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs 32(1)(a) to (i);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry, being the earliest of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a date determined by the Minister that is not more than 180 days after the effective date,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the applicant’s licence, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry date of any import authorization pertaining to the Class A precursor shipment that has been issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that the international obligations of Canada are respected,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure compliance with any requirement of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure compliance with the Act and these Regulations, including reducing the risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: A Class A export permit is valid until the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the permit,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the suspension or revocation under section 22, 23 or 24 of the licence pertaining to the permit, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the suspension or revocation of the permit under section 36, 37 or 38.

Section.Text: The Minister shall refuse to issue a Class A export permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a circumstance described in any of paragraphs 17(1)(b) to (g) and (j), with any modifications that the circumstances require, exists with respect to the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant does not hold a licence that applies to the Class A precursor sought to be exported or the applicant’s licence will expire before the proposed date of export;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has been informed that one of the following applications made by the applicant with regard to the licence pertaining to the Class A precursor sought to be exported is to be refused under section 17, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the application under section 14 to issue or renew the licence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an application under section 19 to amend the licence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the export shipment to which the permit would apply would contravene the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: within seven days after the Minister sends pre-export notification of the proposed export to the competent authority in the country of final destination, the Minister receives written notice from the authority that it has refused to authorize the proposed import or that it objects to the import; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the shipment would not be in conformity with the import authorization or letter of non-objection issued by the competent authority in the proposed country of final destination.

Section.Text: The holder of a Class A export permit shall ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an official copy of the permit is attached to the Class A precursor shipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an official copy of the permit is surrendered to a customs officer at the port of exit at the time of export.

Subsection.Text: Within 15 days after a shipment containing a Class A precursor is exported, the holder of a Class A export permit for the shipment shall provide the Minister with a declaration containing the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the holder and permit number for the shipment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the port of exit from Canada for the shipment;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of export;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the precursor being shipped or a description of its chemical composition, as stated in the permit; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the precursor being shipped and, if it is a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains.

Subsection.Text: The declaration must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the responsible person in charge or the alternate responsible person in charge for the licensed site from which the shipment will be transported to the port of exit; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement that all information set out in the declaration is correct and complete to the best of the knowledge of the signatory.

Section.Text: The Minister shall revoke a Class A export permit at the request of the holder or if the holder informs the Minister that the permit has been lost or stolen.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister shall revoke a Class A export permit in accordance with subsection 84(1) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a circumstance described in any of paragraphs 23(1)(a) to (f) exists with respect to the licence pertaining to the Class A precursor to be exported; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the export permit was issued on the basis of false or misleading information or false or falsified documents.

Subsection.Text: The Minister is not required to revoke a Class A export permit under subsection (1) if the holder of the permit meets the conditions referred to in subsection 23(2).

The Minister may revoke a Class A export permit if the holder fails to comply with the decision of the Minister to suspend the permit under section 38 or if the situation giving rise to the suspension is not rectified.

Section.Text: The Minister shall suspend a Class A export permit without prior notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence pertaining to the Class A precursor sought to be exported has expired or has been suspended or revoked;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health, safety or security;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to suspect that the continuation of the permit presents a risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the shipment would not be in conformity with an import authorization or letter of non-objection issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it is discovered that the export would contravene the laws of the country of final destination or a country of transit or transhipment.

Heading.TitleText: Application for a Permit for Transit or Transhipment

Subsection.Text: If a Class A precursor is to be shipped from one country to another country by a route that requires it to be in transit through Canada or to be transhipped in Canada, the exporter in the country of export or an agent or mandatary in Canada of that exporter must apply to the Minister for a permit for transit or transhipment by providing the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the exporter and their address and telephone number in the country of export;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the importer and their address and telephone number in the country of final destination;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of the person who will be responsible for the precursor while it is in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the Class A precursor for which the permit is requested,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, if any, otherwise a description of its chemical composition, and Harmonized System Code,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a preparation or mixture, its brand name, if any, and the names of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity sought to be shipped and, if it is a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the expected date of transit or transhipment in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed ports of entry into and exit from Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: each proposed means of transportation that is to be used in Canada for the precursor; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a transhipment, the address, if applicable, of every place in Canada at which the precursor will be stored during the transhipment and the expected duration of each storage.

Subsection.Text: The application must be accompanied by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the export authorization issued by the competent authority in the country of export, if applicable; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the import authorization issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination, if applicable.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by a person who is authorized for that purpose by the exporter, who may be an agent or mandatary in Canada of the exporter; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: state that all the information submitted in support of the application is correct and complete to the best of the knowledge of the signatory.

Heading.TitleText: Issuance of a Permit for Transit or Transhipment

Section.Text: Subject to section 41, if the requirements of section 39 are met, the Minister shall issue to the applicant a permit for transit or transhipment that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs 39(1)(a) to (h);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the countries of export and final destination and the numbers and expiry dates of the export and import authorizations issued by a competent authority in each of those countries, if applicable; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date and the expiry date of the permit.

Section.Text: The Minister shall refuse to issue a permit for transit or transhipment if the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the issuance of the permit

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: would not be in conformity with an international obligation of Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: would not be in compliance with the Act, any regulation under the Act, or a law of the country of export, of the country of final destination or of a country of transit or transhipment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: would likely create a risk to public health, safety or security, including the risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the import authorization issued by a competent authority in the country of final destination has expired or has been suspended or revoked.

Section.Text: The holder of a permit for transit or transhipment shall surrender an official copy of the permit to a customs officer at the port of entry set out in the permit.
Within 15 days after a shipment departs from Canada, the holder of a permit for transit or transhipment that applies the shipment must notify the Minister in writing of the departure date.
The Minister shall revoke a permit for transit or transhipment at the request of the holder or if the holder informs the Minister that the permit has been lost or stolen.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister shall revoke a permit for transit or transhipment in accordance with subsection 84(1) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit was issued on the basis of false or misleading information or false or falsified documents;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the permit has failed to comply with a provision of the Act or any regulation under the Act or a term or condition of a permit for transit or transhipment issued under these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority, the United Nations or a peace officer raises a reasonable belief that the licensed dealer has been or will be involved in the diversion of a controlled substance or precursor to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the continuation of the permit would likely create a risk to public health, safety or security, including the risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister is not required to revoke a permit under paragraph (1)(a) or (b) if the holder of the permit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act and any regulation made or continued under the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, specified corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act and these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may revoke a permit if the holder fails to comply with the decision of the Minister to suspend the permit under section 46 or if the situation giving rise to the suspension is not rectified.

Section.Text: The Minister shall suspend a permit for transit or transhipment without prior notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there has been an expiration, suspension or revocation of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the export permit issued by the competent authority in the country of origin, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the import permit issued by the country of final destination;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health, safety or security; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to suspect that the continuation of the permit presents a risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: No licensed dealer may destroy a Class A precursor except in accordance with subsections (2) to (4).
A licensed dealer may destroy, at the site set out in their licence, a Class A precursor named in it if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prior to the destruction, the licensed dealer makes a record showing;

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the precursor, if any, otherwise a description of its chemical composition, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of the precursor to be destroyed and, in the case of a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is conducted in accordance with a method that complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed dealer makes a record of the date and method of destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction occurs in the presence of at least two qualified witnesses who work for the licensed dealer, one of whom is the responsible person in charge or the alternate responsible person in charge, if any, for the licensed site; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: once the destruction is completed, the person carrying out the destruction and each person mentioned in paragraph (d) sign and date a joint declaration certifying that the precursor was completely destroyed, to which each signatory shall add their name in printed letters.

Subsection.Text: A person is qualified to witness the destruction of a Class A precursor if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is the responsible person in charge for the site or, if applicable, the alternate responsible person in charge for the site set out in the licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person works for or provides services to the licensed dealer and acts in a senior position.

Subsection.Text: If a Class A precursor is to be destroyed elsewhere than at the licensed site, the licensed dealer must ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appropriate measures are taken to ensure security of the precursor during transit in order to prevent the diversion of a Class A precursor to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is carried out by a business that specializes in the destruction of dangerous goods;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the destruction is conducted in accordance with a method that complies with all federal, provincial and municipal environmental protection legislation applicable to the place of destruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: once the destruction is completed, the individual within the business carrying out the destruction provides the licensed dealer with a declaration attesting to the complete destruction of the precursor, showing

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the precursor, if any, otherwise a description of its chemical composition, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of the precursor destroyed and, in the case of a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains;

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of destruction,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the method of destruction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: their name and signature as well as the name and signature of another person within the business who witnessed the destruction.

Subsection.Text: With respect to a Class A precursor that is a preparation or mixture, a person who produces or imports, or desires to do so, may apply for an authorization certificate with respect to the preparation or mixture by submitting an application to the Minister containing the following information and statements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s name or, if the applicant is a corporation, their corporate name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant is a licensed dealer, the number of their licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant is not the producer of the preparation or mixture, the name of the person who produced the precursor or, if the person is a corporation, its corporate name;

Paragraph.Label: (b.2)
Paragraph.Text: the address, telephone number and facsimile transmission number, if any, of the person who produced the preparation or mixture;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the preparation or mixture for which the application is made

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, if any, otherwise a description of its chemical composition, and its brand name, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its qualitative and quantitative composition including all chemical ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its physical and chemical properties and any difference between those properties and the physical and chemical properties of the chemical ingredients that are precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of analyses used to evaluate its purity and stability, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: its intended use;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement, by the person who produced the preparation or mixture, that the preparation or mixture is made in such a way that no precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act can be readily extracted, having regard to the complexity and cost of extraction, and that the preparation or mixture cannot be used in the production of a controlled substance; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement, by the person who produced the preparation or mixture, justifying the application for the certificate, and identifying the scientific principles and any other information in support of the statement under paragraph (d).

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a person working for the applicant having supervisory responsibilities pertaining to the preparation or mixture and sufficient knowledge to confirm the information set out in the application, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the senior person in charge for the site, if the applicant is a licensed dealer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement that all information set out in the application is correct and complete to the best of the knowledge of the signatory.
