Subsection.Text: Subject to section 50, if an application complies with the requirements of section 48, the Minister shall issue to the applicant an authorization certificate that indicates

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the certificate number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, if any, of the preparation or mixture that is the subject of the certificate, otherwise a description of its chemical composition, and its brand name, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the applicant or, if the applicant is a corporation, their corporate name;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant is not the producer of the preparation or mixture, the name of the person who produced the precursor or, if the person is a corporation, its corporate name;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that international obligations of Canada are respected, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure compliance with the Act and these Regulations, including reducing the risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The holder of an authorization certificate shall, on request, provide a copy of the certificate to any person conducting an activity in relation to the preparation or mixture to which the certificate applies.

Section.Text: The Minister shall refuse to issue an authorization certificate if, according to the information provided and scientific data or other information or evidence available, a precursor set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act can be readily extracted from the preparation or mixture that is the subject of the application, having regard to the complexity and cost of extraction, or the preparation or mixture can be used in the production of a controlled substance.
A person who imports or exports a Class A precursor that is a preparation or mixture mentioned in an authorization certificate shall ensure that the shipment is accompanied by a document containing:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the preparation or mixture is subject to an authorization certificate under section 49; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the certificate number for the preparation or mixture.

Section.Text: The Minister shall revoke an authorization certificate at the request of the holder.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall, in accordance with subsection 84(1), revoke an authorization certificate if the certificate

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was issued on the basis of false or misleading information, or false or falsified documents; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has been the subject of a suspension under paragraph 54(a) and subsection 84(2) and the suspension has not been complied with.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may revoke an authorization certificate if the holder fails to comply with a decision of the Minister to suspend the certificate under section 54, or if the situation giving rise to the suspension is not rectified.

Section.Text: The Minister shall, without prior notice, suspend an authorization certificate if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: new scientific evidence or other new information demonstrates that a precursor set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act can be readily extracted from the preparation or mixture mentioned in the certificate, having regard to the complexity and cost of extraction, or demonstrates that the preparation or mixture may be or has been used in the production of a controlled substance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health, safety or security; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to suspect that the continuation of the certificate presents a risk of a Class A precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Section.Text: With respect to a Class B precursor that is a preparation or mixture, a person who conducts an activity mentioned in section 57 is exempt from the requirements of these Regulations, except requirements applying to production for the purpose of sale or provision, if the preparation or mixture contains a precursor set out in Part 2 of Schedule VI to the Act and the contained precursor, either alone or with any other precursor of the same type, does not constitute more than 30% of the preparation or mixture by weight or volume, in the case of a solid or liquid, respectively.

A person who uses a Class B precursor that is described in section 55 or is the subject of an authorization certificate under section 77, to produce another Class B precursor that is a preparation or mixture, is exempt from the requirements of these Regulations in respect of that production.

Subsection.Text: No person other than a registered dealer may produce a Class B precursor for the purpose of sale or provision.
A registered dealer may import a Class B precursor.
Subject to subsection (4), a registered dealer may export a Class B precursor and may possess the precursor for the purpose of the export.

In the case of a country named in a table referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) and a Class B precursor identified in the table as one requiring notice of pre-exportation to that country, a registered dealer may only export the Class B precursor to the country if the registered dealer holds a Class B export permit in respect of the precursor and complies with the terms and conditions of the permit:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the table entitled “Governments that have requested pre-export notifications pursuant to article 12, paragraph 10(a), of the 1988 Convention”, contained in the most recent INCB annual report concerning the implementation of article 12 of the United Nations Convention against Illicit Traffic in Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances of 1988; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the table entitled Supplementary Table of Countries Requiring Pre-Export Notification With Regard to Class B Precursors, published by the Department of Health, as amended from time to time, listing the countries that, according to notification from the INCB to the Minister since publication of the most recent annual report referred to in paragraph (a), have made a formal request to the United Nations to receive notice of pre-exportation in respect of the shipment to the country of Class B precursors.

Section.Text: Despite section 57, with respect to a Class B precursor that is a preparation or mixture, a person may import, export or possess for those purposes if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the preparation or mixture is the subject of an authorization certificate under section 77; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no notice indicating that the certificate has been revoked or is under suspension appears on the following Health Canada Internet site:

Section.Text: To be eligible to apply for registration, a person must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who ordinarily resides in Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a corporation that has its head office or a branch office in Canada.

Subsection.Text: A registered dealer must designate a senior person in charge, who may, if appropriate, be the registered dealer, to have overall responsibility for management of the registered dealer’s Class B precursor activities.

A registered dealer must designate a contact person, for each site where the registered dealer conducts Class B precursor activities, to work at the site, who may, if appropriate, be the senior person in charge, and who has good knowledge of the Class B precursor activities carried out at the site and the use and handling of the relevant precursors including the risk of those precursors being diverted to an illicit market or use.
The senior person in charge

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must be familiar with the provisions of the Act and these Regulations that apply to the registered dealer’s Class B precursor activities and have sufficient knowledge concerning the use and handling of the Class B precursors dealt with by the registered dealer to which the registration applies, including the risk of those precursors being diverted to an illicit market or use, to enable them to properly perform their responsibilities; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: must not have been convicted, as an adult, within the previous 10 years, of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated drug offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated criminal offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence committed outside of Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii).

Subsection.Text: An application for registration or to renew a registration shall be made to the Minister and contain the following information and statement:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s name or, if the applicant is a corporation, their corporate name and any other name registered with a province, under which the applicant will carry out the activities set out in the application or will identify itself;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s address or, if the applicant is a corporation, their head office address in Canada, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s precursor activity profile concerning Class B precursors, being

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, if any, of each Class B precursor that the applicant intends to produce for sale or provision, import, export or have in possession for export, otherwise a description of its chemical composition,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if a Class B precursor referred to in subparagraph (i) is a preparation or mixture, its product classification having regard to its intended use and the names of all precursors set out in Part 2 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains;

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Class B precursor activity mentioned in section 57 that the applicant intends to carry out in respect of each precursor identified under subparagraphs (i),

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the address of each site where the applicant intends to conduct Class B precursor activities, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the postal address of each site to which subparagraph (iv) applies, if different,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, date of birth and gender of the senior person in charge and their telephone number, facsimile transmission number and e-mail address;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for each site referred to in subparagraph (c)(iv), the name, telephone number, facsimile transmission number and e-mail address of the contact person to be reached to obtain information concerning precursor activity at the site;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an application to renew a registration, the number of the registration to be renewed; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the internal controls pertaining to Class B precursors are sufficient to support a reliable system of record-keeping in respect of the precursor activities and precursor inventory applicable to the registered dealer’s precursor activity profile and to permit the Minister to verify those activities.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the senior person in charge for the applicant; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement by the signatory that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the information and documents provided in the application are correct and complete to the best of the knowledge of the signatory, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the senior person in charge has the authority to bind the applicant.

Subsection.Text: The application must be accompanied by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement signed by the senior person in charge stating that they have not, as an adult, been convicted within the previous 10 years of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated drug offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated criminal offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence committed outside of Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement signed by the senior person in charge

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: consenting to having a criminal record check carried out for them, as an adult, in respect of the offences mentioned in paragraph (a) during the preceding 10 years,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: agreeing to provide all information and to submit to any means of identification required to obtain the criminal record check, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: to pay the fee established by the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, Criminal Record Verification for Civil Purposes Fee Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, a copy of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the certificate of incorporation or other constituting instrument for the applicant, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any document filed with a province in which there is a site referred to in subparagraph (1)(c)(iv) that states the applicant’s corporate name and any other name registered with the province under which the applicant will carry out activities in respect of precursors or will identify itself.

Section.Text: The Minister may, on receiving an application made under this Part, require the submission of any additional information that pertains to the information contained in the application and that is necessary for the Minister to process the application.
Subject to section 63, if the requirements of section 60 are met, the Minister shall register the applicant or renew the applicant’s registration, and issue a registration certificate indicating

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registration number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the registered dealer or, if the registered dealer is a corporation, its corporate name;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s address or, if the applicant is a corporation, its head office address in Canada, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry of the certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that the international obligations of Canada are respected, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure compliance with the Act and these Regulations, including reducing the risk of a Class B precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister shall refuse to register an applicant or renew an applicant’s registration if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant is not eligible under section 58;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that any information or document included in the application is false or misleading;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: additional information required under section 61 has not been provided or is insufficient to process the application;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the registration would permit an activity that would not be in compliance with an international obligation of Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority, the United Nations or a peace officer raises a reasonable belief that the applicant has been or will be involved in the diversion of a controlled substance or precursor to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant is not, or within the previous 10 years has not been, in compliance with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a provision of the Act or a regulation made or continued under the Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a term or condition of a licence, registration certificate or permit issued to it under any regulation made or continued under the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the senior person in charge mentioned in the application has been convicted, as an adult, within the previous 10 years of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated drug offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated criminal offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence committed outside of Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii); or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the registration would likely create a risk to public health, safety or security, including the risk of a Class B precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The Minister is not required to refuse to register an applicant or renew an applicant’s registration under paragraph (1)(b) or (f) if the applicant

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act and any regulation made or continued under the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, specified corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act and these Regulations.

Section.Text: A registration is valid for a maximum of five years from the effective date of the registration.

Subsection.Text: A registered dealer shall give notice to the Minister in writing of any change of information provided in the application for registration or any subsequent notice of change given under this subsection.
Subject to subsection (5), the notice shall be given not later than 10 days after the change takes effect.
If the change deals with information shown on the registration certificate, the registered dealer shall include the original certificate with the notice given under subsection (1).
Subject to paragraphs 67(1)(e) and (f), if the requirements of subsections (1) to (3) are met, the Minister shall amend the registration certificate accordingly.
If the change deals with the designation of a replacement for the senior person in charge, the registered dealer shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: apply for the approval of the Minister before making the change; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include with the application the information mentioned in paragraph 60(1)(d) and the statements mentioned in paragraphs 60(3)(a) and (b).

Subsection.Text: If the senior person in charge ceases to act in that capacity due to death or an unforseen circumstance, the registered dealer may authorize another person who satisfies the requirements of subsection 59(3) to act as the interim senior person in charge until approval is granted by the Minister concerning the designation of a replacement for the senior person in charge.
A registered dealer shall advise the Minister within 10 days if the senior person in charge for the site ceases to act in that capacity.

Section.Text: The Minister shall revoke a registration and the corresponding registration certificate if the registered dealer so requests or notifies the Minister that the certificate has been lost or stolen.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2) and subsection 84(1), the Minister shall revoke a registration and the corresponding registration certificate if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registered dealer is no longer an eligible person under section 58;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the registration was made on the basis of false or misleading information or false or falsified documents;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the registered dealer has contravened the Act or any regulation under the Act, a condition of the registration or a provision of a registration certificate, a licence or an import or export permit issued under any regulation under the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it is discovered that the senior person in charge has been convicted, as an adult, within the previous 10 years of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated drug offence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a designated criminal offence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an offence committed outside of Canada that, if committed in Canada, would have constituted an offence referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: information received from a competent authority, the United Nations or a peace officer raises a reasonable belief that the registered dealer has been or will be involved in the diversion of a controlled substance or precursor to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (e.1)
Paragraph.Text: the continuation of the registration would likely create a risk to public health, safety or security, including the risk of a Class B precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the registration would permit, having regard to an activity mentioned in a notice of change of information, an activity that would not be in compliance with an international obligation of Canada.

Subsection.Text: The Minister is not required to revoke a registration and the corresponding certificate under paragraph (1)(b) or (c) if the registered dealer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: does not have a history of non-compliance with the Act and any regulation made or continued under the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has carried out, or signed an undertaking to carry out, corrective measures to ensure compliance with the Act and these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may revoke a registration and the corresponding certificate if the registered dealer fails to comply with the decision of the Minister to suspend the registration and certificate under section 68 or if the situation giving rise to the suspension is not rectified.

Section.Text: The Minister shall suspend a registration and the corresponding certificate without prior notice if the Minister has reasonable grounds

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health, safety or security; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to suspect that the continuation of the registration and the certificate presents a risk of a Class B precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: An application for a Class B export permit shall be made by a registered dealer to the Minister in writing and contain the following information and statements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registered dealer’s name and address and the number of their registration certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the business number assigned to the registered dealer by the Minister of National Revenue;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for the Class B precursor sought to be exported

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name or a description of its chemical composition, and its Harmonization System Code,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a preparation or mixture, its brand name, if any, and the names of all precursors set out in Part 2 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity sought to be exported, and in the case of a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all precursors set out in Part 2 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the importer and their address in the country of final destination;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed means of transportation;

Paragraph.Label: (e.1)
Paragraph.Text: the name of any proposed country of transit or transhipment;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the carrier that is proposed to transport the precursor through the port of exit;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed port of exit from Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed date of export;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the proposed customs broker for the registered dealer, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a statement by the registered dealer that to the best of their knowledge the shipment would not contravene the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the registered dealer consents to the disclosure of information contained in the application to the INCB and the competent authority in the country of final destination for the purpose of verifying information contained in the application.

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the senior person in charge; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement that the information and statements provided in the application are correct and complete to the best of the knowledge of the signatory.

Subsection.Text: The application may deal with more than one Class B precursor for the same shipment.
Subject to section 71, if the requirements of section 69 are met, the Minister shall issue to the applicant a Class B export permit that indicates

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the permit number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the information referred to in paragraphs 69(1)(a) to (i);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of expiry, being the earliest of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a date determined by the Minister that is not more than 180 days after the effective date,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of expiry of the registration of the applicant, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of expiry for any import authorization issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination in respect of the importation of the Class B precursor; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that the international obligations of Canada are respected,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure compliance with a requirement of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure compliance with the Act and these Regulations, including reducing the risk of a Class B precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: A Class B export permit is valid until the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expiry date set out in the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the suspension or revocation under section 66, 67 or 68 of the registration; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the suspension or revocation under section 73, 74 or 75 of the export permit.

Section.Text: The Minister shall refuse to issue a Class B export permit if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant is not a registered dealer or is a registered dealer whose registration will expire prior to the proposed date of export;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a circumstance described in any of paragraphs 63(1)(b) to (f) and (h), with any modifications that the circumstances require, exists with respect to the permit application;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the export shipment to which the permit would apply would contravene the laws of the country of final destination or any country of transit or transhipment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: within seven days after the Minister sends pre-export notification of the proposed export to the competent authority in the country of final destination, the Minister has received written notice from the authority that it has refused to authorize the proposed import or that it objects to the import; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed shipment would not be in conformity with an import authorization or letter of non-objection issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination.

Section.Text: The holder of a Class B export permit shall ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an official copy of the permit is attached to the Class B precursor shipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an official copy of the permit is surrendered to a customs officer at the customs office at the port of exit set out in the permit.

Subsection.Text: Within 15 days after a shipment containing a Class B precursor is exported, the holder of a Class B export permit for the shipment shall provide the Minister with a declaration containing the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the holder and permit number for the shipment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the port of exit from Canada for the shipment;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of export;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the precursor being shipped or a description of its chemical composition, as stated in the permit; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the precursor being shipped and, if it is a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all precursors set out in Part 2 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains.

Subsection.Text: The declaration must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by the senior person in charge designated by the registered dealer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement that all information set out in the declaration is correct and complete to the best of the knowledge of the signatory.

Section.Text: The Minister shall revoke a Class B export permit at the request of the holder or if the holder informs the Minister that the permit has been lost or stolen.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister shall revoke a Class B export permit in accordance with subsection 84(1) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a circumstance described in any of paragraphs 67(1)(a) to (f) exists with respect to the registration of the holder of the permit; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the export permit was issued on the basis of false or misleading information or false or falsified documents.

Subsection.Text: The Minister is not required to revoke a Class B export permit under subsection (1) if the holder of the permit meets the conditions referred to in subsection 63(2).

The Minister may revoke a Class B export permit if the holder fails to comply with the decision of the Minister to suspend the permit under section 75 or if the situation giving rise to the suspension is not rectified.

Section.Text: The Minister shall suspend a Class B export permit without prior notice if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the registration certificate of the holder of the permit has expired or has been suspended or revoked;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health, safety or security;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to suspect that the continuation of the permit presents a risk of a Class B precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the shipment would not be in conformity with an import authorization or letter of non-objection issued by the competent authority in the country of final destination; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it is discovered that the export would contravene the laws of the country of final destination or a country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: With respect to a Class B precursor that is a preparation or mixture, a person who produces for the purpose of sale or provision, or imports, or desires to do either, may apply for an authorization certificate for the preparation or mixture, by submitting an application to the Minister containing the following information and statements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s name or, if the applicant is a corporation, their corporate name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant is a registered dealer, the number of their registration certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: if the person is not the producer of the preparation or mixture, the name of the producer or, if the producer is a corporation, its corporate name;

Paragraph.Label: (b.2)
Paragraph.Text: the address and the telephone number and facsimile transmission number, if any, of the producer of the preparation or mixture;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the preparation or mixture for which the application is made

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, if any, otherwise a description of its chemical composition, and its brand name, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its qualitative and quantitative composition including all chemical ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its physical and chemical properties and any difference between those properties and the physical and chemical properties of the chemical ingredients that are precursors set out in Part 2 of Schedule VI to the Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of analyses used to evaluate its purity and stability, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: its intended use;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement, by the producer of the preparation or mixture, that the preparation or mixture is made in such a way that no precursor set out in Part 2 of Schedule VI to the Act contained in it can be readily extracted, having regard to the complexity and cost of extraction, and that the preparation or mixture cannot be used in the production of a controlled substance; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement, by the producer of the preparation or mixture, justifying the application for the certificate, and identifying the scientific principles and any other information in support of the statement under paragraph (d).

Subsection.Text: The application must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be signed by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a person working for the applicant having supervisory responsibilities pertaining to the preparation or mixture and sufficient knowledge to confirm the information set out in the application, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the senior person in charge for the site, if the applicant is a registered dealer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: include a statement that all information set out in the application is correct and complete to the best of the knowledge of the signatory.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 78, if an application complies with the requirements of section 76, the Minister shall issue to the applicant an authorization certificate that indicates

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the certificate number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, if any, of the preparation or mixture that is the subject of the certificate, otherwise a description of its chemical composition, and its brand name, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the applicant or, if the applicant is a corporation, their corporate name;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that are necessary to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that international obligations of Canada are respected, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure compliance with the Act and these Regulations, including reducing the risk of a Class B precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: The holder of an authorization certificate shall, on request, provide a copy of the certificate to any person conducting an activity in relation to the preparation or mixture to which the certificate applies.

Section.Text: The Minister shall refuse to issue an authorization certificate if, according to the information provided and scientific data or other information or evidence available, a precursor set out in Part 2 of Schedule VI to the Act can be readily extracted from the preparation or mixture that is the subject of the application, having regard to the complexity and cost of extraction, or the preparation or mixture can be used in the production of a controlled substance.
A person who exports a preparation or mixture mentioned in an authorization certificate shall ensure that the shipment is accompanied by a document containing:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the preparation or mixture is subject to an authorization certificate under section 77; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the certificate number for the preparation or mixture.

Section.Text: The Minister shall revoke an authorization certificate at the request of the holder.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall, in accordance with subsection 84(1), revoke an authorization certificate if the certificate

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was issued on the basis of false or misleading information, or false or falsified documents; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has been the subject of a suspension under paragraph 82(a) and subsection 84(2) and the suspension has not been complied with.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may revoke an authorization certificate if the holder fails to comply with a decision of the Minister to suspend the certificate under section 82, or if the situation giving rise to the suspension is not rectified.

Section.Text: The Minister shall, without prior notice, suspend an authorization certificate if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: new scientific evidence or other new information demonstrates that a precursor set out in Part 2 of Schedule VI to the Act can be readily extracted from the preparation or mixture mentioned in the certificate, having regard to the complexity and cost of extraction, or demonstrates that the preparation or mixture may be or has been used in the production of a controlled substance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the suspension is necessary to protect public health, safety or security; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister has reasonable grounds to suspect that the continuation of the authorization certificate presents a risk of a Class B precursor being diverted to an illicit market or use.

Heading.TitleText: Restricted Access to Class A Precursors

Section.Text: Every licensed dealer shall restrict access to locations at the licensed site where Class A precursors are kept to persons whose presence is required by their work responsibilities.

Heading.TitleText: Notice of Refusal, Revocation or Suspension

Subsection.Text: If the Minister proposes to refuse to issue, amend or renew, or proposes to revoke, a licence, a registration and the corresponding registration certificate, an authorization certificate, an import or export permit or a permit for transit or transhipment, issued under these Regulations, the Minister shall provide the applicant or the holder with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a notice of the intended action and a written report that sets out the reasons for the proposed refusal or revocation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an opportunity to be heard within a reasonable time in respect of the proposed refusal or revocation.

Subsection.Text: A decision of the Minister to suspend a licence, a registration and the corresponding registration certificate, an authorization certificate, an import or export permit or a permit for transit or transhipment, issued under these Regulations, takes effect as soon as the Minister notifies the holder of the decision and provides a written report of the reasons for the suspension.
A person who receives a notice of suspension referred to in subsection (2) may, within 10 days after receiving the notice, provide the Minister with reasons why the suspension is unfounded.

Heading.TitleText: Books, Registers, Electronic Data and Other Records

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer shall keep at the licensed site books, registers, electronic data and other records pertaining to each Class A precursor brought to the site, produced or packaged at the site, used at the site for their own purposes, destroyed at the site or removed from the site, showing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the precursor

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, if any, otherwise a description of its chemical composition,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a preparation or mixture, its brand name, if any, and the names of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the type of activity pertaining to the precursor, whether purchase, receipt, production, packaging, use for their own purposes, sale, provision, sending, delivering, transporting, importation, exportation or destruction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of precursor and, in the case of a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date the activity occurred; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a precursor

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: purchased or otherwise acquired, the name, address and telephone number of the person from whom the precursor was purchased or acquired,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: sold or provided, sent, delivered or transported, the name and address of the purchaser or recipient,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: that is imported, the name and address of the exporter in the country of export and the name of any country of transit or transhipment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: that is exported, the name and address of the importer in the country of final destination and the name of any country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer shall keep in their books and registers all end-use declarations obtained under section 8.

A licensed dealer shall keep, at the licensed site, a record showing, for each day on which a person has access to a place at the site where a Class A precursor is kept, the person’s name and the date of access.

With respect to each Class B precursor brought to a site following import, produced at the site or removed from the site for export, a registered dealer shall keep at the site books, registers, electronic data and other records showing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the precursor,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, if any, otherwise a description of its chemical composition, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a preparation or mixture, its brand name, if any, and the name of all precursors set out in Part 2 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the type of activity pertaining to the precursor, whether production for sale or provision, import or export;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date the activity occurred; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a precursor

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that is imported, the name and address of the exporter in the country of export and the name of any country of transit or transhipment, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: that is exported, the name and address of the importer in the country of final destination and the name of any country of transit or transhipment.

Subsection.Text: Information referred to in subsections (1) to (4) and a record referred to in section 86 shall be retained for at least two years after the information was recorded or the record was made, except that an end-use declaration shall be kept for at least two years after the calendar year in which it was obtained.
A licensed dealer and a registered dealer shall make the records and documents required to be kept under this Part available for inspection by an inspector.
A licensed dealer and a registered dealer, if requested by the Minister in writing, shall provide to the Minister a copy of any record or document required to be kept under this Part.

Section.Text: If a licence expires without being renewed or is revoked the former licensed dealer shall,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: retain the records and information that they were required to keep or make under sections 85 and 86 for at least two years after the expiry or revocation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: at the written request of the Minister, provide the Minister with a copy of any record or document required to be kept under paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: A licensed dealer and a registered dealer shall, on becoming aware of the transaction, make a record of every transaction occurring in the course of their activities in respect of which there are reasonable grounds to suspect that the transaction is related to the diversion of a precursor to an illicit market or use.

For the purpose of subsection (1), the factors to be considered in assessing if a transaction or group of transactions give rise to reasonable grounds to suspect that the transaction or group of transactions is related to the diversion of a precursor to an illicit market or use include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the composition and chemical properties of the precursor involved, the illicit use that may be made of it and the risk of its diversion to an illicit market or use having regard to those factors;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the precursor involved and, in the case of a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all precursors set out in Parts 1 or 2 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the intended use of the precursor stated by the other party to the transaction;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed means of transportation, route of delivery, place of origin or place of destination;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the method of payment involved; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of prior dealings between the dealer and the other party to the transaction, any suspicious departure from the pattern of the prior dealings.

Subsection.Text: A suspicious transaction record shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address, telephone number and position with the dealer of the individual making the record;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the identification of the other party to the transaction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: details of the transaction involved, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date and time of the transaction,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of transaction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and quantity of the precursor and, in the case of a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all precursors set out in Parts 1 or 2 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a detailed description of the reasons for suspecting that the transaction is related to the diversion of a precursor to an illicit market or use.

Subsection.Text: No licensed dealer or registered dealer shall disclose that they have made a suspicious transaction record under this section or disclose the contents of the record, with the intent to prejudice a criminal investigation, whether or not a criminal investigation has begun.
No criminal or civil proceedings lie against a licensed dealer or registered dealer for making a suspicious transaction record under this section in good faith.
The Minister is authorized to receive information that is provided voluntarily by a dealer referred to in subsection (1) in respect of a transaction mentioned in that subsection.

Section.Text: A licensed dealer shall make a report to the Minister, in paper or electronic form, within three months after the end of each calendar year, showing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and total quantity of each Class A precursor purchased, received, produced, used for their own purposes, sold, provided, imported, exported or destroyed during the calendar year;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of each Class A precursor in physical inventory taken at the site at the end of the calendar year; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of any Class A precursor that has been lost or wasted in the course of conducting authorized activities during the calendar year.

Subsection.Text: If a licence expires without being renewed or is revoked and the expiry or revocation occurs within the first three months of a calendar year, the former licensed dealer shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the portion of the three calendar months during which the licence was valid, make the report to the Minister referred to in section 87 within three months after the expiry or revocation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the preceding calendar year, make the report to the Minister referred to in section 87 within three months after the end of that calendar year.

Subsection.Text: If a licence expires without being renewed or is revoked and the expiry or revocation occurs after the first three months of the calendar year, the licensed dealer shall, in respect of the portion of the calendar year during which the licence was valid, make the report, referred to in section 87, to the Minister within three months after the expiry or revocation.

For the purpose of paragraph (1)(a) and subsection (2), the information to be furnished is that pertaining to operations for the portion of the calendar year during which the licence was valid and pertaining to the quantity in physical inventory on the date of expiry or revocation.

Section.Text: If a licensed dealer or registered dealer intends to close a site at which one or more precursors are kept, or to remove all precursors from the site, the dealer shall, at least 30 days before the closure or removal, notify the Minister in writing of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the intended closure or removal;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the site to which the precursors will be moved; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of each precursor to be moved.

Section.Text: No one may add to, delete or obliterate from, or alter in any other way, a licence, a registration or authorization certificate, an import or export permit or a permit for transit or transhipment, issued under these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: If a licence or a registration or authorization certificate is renewed, the holder shall, as soon as possible after the effective date of the replacing document, return the replaced document to the Minister.

If a licence, a registration or authorization certificate, an import or export permit or a permit for transit or transhipment, issued under these Regulations, expires without being renewed or is revoked, the holder shall, within 30 days after the expiry or revocation, return the licence, registration or exemption certificate or permit to the Minister.

Heading.TitleText: Security and Reporting of Loss or Theft

Subsection.Text: The holder of a licence, a registration or authorization certificate or an import or export permit issued or granted under these Regulations shall maintain measures necessary to ensure the security of any precursor in their possession, as well as the licence, certificate or permit.

If a licensed dealer or registered dealer experiences a theft of a precursor or an unusual waste or disappearance of a precursor that cannot be explained on the basis of normally accepted business activities, the licensed dealer or registered dealer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall provide notice of the occurrence to a member of a police force within 24 hours after becoming aware of the occurrence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall provide notice of the occurrence to the Minister, in writing, within 72 hours after becoming aware of the occurrence and confirm that the notice required under paragraph (a) has been provided.

Subsection.Text: If a licence, a registration or authorization certificate, an import or export permit or a permit for transit or transhipment issued under these Regulations is lost or stolen, the holder of the document shall provide notice of the occurrence to the Minister, in writing, within 24 hours after becoming aware of the occurrence.

Heading.TitleText: Disclosure of Information by the Minister

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, for the purpose of verifying whether an import or export of a Class A precursor or an export of a Class B precursor complies with an import or export permit issued under these Regulations, communicate the following information to a customs officer in Canada:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the holder of the permit and the number of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the type of permit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the business registration number assigned to the holder of the permit by the Minister of National Revenue;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the precursor that may be imported or exported under the permit

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, if any, otherwise a description of its chemical composition,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a preparation or mixture, its brand name, if any, and the name of all precursors set out in Parts 1 or 2 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity sought to be imported or exported and, if the precursor is a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all precursors set out in Parts 1 or 2 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the duration of validity of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the importer in the country of final destination or of the exporter in the country of origin;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the port of entry into or exit from Canada mentioned in the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed date of import or export;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed means of transportation;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the proposed carrier that is to bring the precursor to the port of entry or the port of exit in Canada, whichever applies;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the proposed customs broker involved, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that apply to the permit; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: whether the permit has been revoked or suspended.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, for the purpose of the administration of these Regulations, communicate to a customs officer in Canada the name of an applicant who has been refused a permit to export a precursor, the precursor involved and the date of the refusal.

The Minister may, for the purpose of verifying whether the transportation of a Class A precursor in transit through Canada or the transhipment of a Class A precursor in Canada complies with a permit for transit or transhipment issued under these Regulations, communicate the following information to a customs officer in Canada:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the type of permit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the exporter in the country of export;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the Class A precursor that may be transported in transit or transhipped under the permit

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its name, if any, otherwise a description of its chemical composition,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is a salt, the name of the salt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the precursor is a preparation or mixture, its brand name, if any, and the names of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity sought to be transported in transit or transhipped and, if the precursor is a preparation or mixture, the quantity of all precursors set out in Part 1 of Schedule VI to the Act that it contains; and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a raw material, its purity;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the duration of validity of the permit;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the countries of export and final destination and the numbers and expiry dates of the export and import authorizations issued by a competent authority in each of those countries, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed ports of entry into and exit from Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the expected date of transit or transhipment in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: each means of transportation that is proposed to be used in Canada for the precursor;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person who is responsible for the precursor while it is in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a transhipment, for every place in Canada where the precursor will be stored during the transhipment, the address and the expected duration of storage; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: whether the permit has been revoked or suspended.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, for the purpose of verifying whether a precursor that is a preparation or mixture is the subject of an authorization certificate under these Regulations and may be imported, exported, transported in transit through Canada or transhipped in Canada without the appropriate permit under these Regulations, communicate the following information to a customs officer in Canada:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the preparation or mixture, if any, otherwise a description of its chemical composition, and its brand name, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person who applied for the authorization certificate, or, if the applicant is a corporation, its corporate name;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any conditions that apply to the certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: whether the certificate has been revoked or suspended.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, for the purpose of enabling Canada to fulfil its international obligations under section 12 of the United Nations Convention Against Illicit Traffic in Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances, 1988, communicate the following information to the INCB or a competent authority for the administration of these Regulations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: information pertaining to an activity authorized by a licence, registration or authorization certificate or permit issued or granted to a person under these Regulations, including the person’s name, the nature of the authorized activity and any applicable conditions; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: information in respect of precursor activities pertaining to a precursor obtained under the Act or these Regulations, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: information contained in the books, records and other documents mentioned in subsections 85(1) to (4),

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: information provided in an annual report made under section 87, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: information obtained by an inspector under section 31 of the Act.

Subsection.Text: The Minister is authorized to receive, for the purpose of the administration of these Regulations, information provided by the INCB, a competent authority, the United Nations or a peace officer.

Section.Text: With respect to a Class A precursor, the requirements of paragraph 6(1)(c) and subsections 6(2) and 9(1) concerning sale or provision, possession for the purpose of sale or provision and transport do not apply to a pharmacist, practitioner or hospital that sells or provides preparations or mixtures containing Class A precursors only on a retail basis.
A pharmacist may, pursuant to a prescription, compound a preparation or mixture using a precursor.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist may sell or provide a preparation or mixture that contains a Class A precursor set out in column 1 of the schedule, in a quantity, per transaction, exceeding the maximum quantity, expressed as an absolute quantity or per package, specified for the contained precursor in column 2 of the schedule, if the pharmacist sells or provides preparations or mixtures containing Class A precursors exclusively on a retail basis and the transaction is made under a prescription.
The prescription must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: written, dated and signed by the practitioner who issued it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provided verbally by a practitioner; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: transferred to the pharmacist in accordance with the requirements of section 91.7.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who receives a verbal prescription for a preparation or mixture containing a Class A precursor must, before filling it, record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the individual or owner of the animal for whose benefit the prescription is provided;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the prescription was provided;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of the preparation or mixture specified in the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the recording pharmacist and the name of the practitioner who issued the prescription;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the directions for use specified by the practitioner; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the prescription is to be refilled, the number of times it may be refilled and, if applicable, the interval between refills.

Subsection.Text: The pharmacist must retain, in accordance with section 91.95, a hard copy of the prescription or a written record of it.
Subject to section 91.6, a pharmacist who fills a written or verbal prescription for a preparation or mixture containing a Class A precursor must record the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date the prescription was filled;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of the preparation or mixture provided when the prescription was filled;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist’s name or initials; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the prescription.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist who fills a written prescription shall retain the prescription in accordance with section 91.95.

Section.Text: A pharmacist may only refill a prescription for a preparation or mixture containing a Class A precursor if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the practitioner who issued the prescription expressly directs that it may be refilled and specifies the number of refills;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the pharmacist makes a record of each refill in accordance with subsection 91.5(1), with any modifications that the circumstances require;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: at least one refill remains on the prescription; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if an interval between refills has been specified by the practitioner, the interval has expired.

Subsection.Text: A pharmacist may transfer a prescription for a preparation or mixture containing a Class A precursor to another pharmacist or to a hospital.
Before a pharmacist sells or provides a preparation or mixture containing a Class A precursor to an individual under a prescription that is transferred under subsection (1), the pharmacist shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a verbal transfer, record the information required by subsection 91.4(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a written transfer, obtain from the transferring pharmacist a copy of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the prescription written by the practitioner, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the written record, made in accordance with subsection 91.4(2), of the practitioner’s verbal prescription; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in all cases, record

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the transferring pharmacist,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of authorized refills remaining and, if applicable, the specified interval between refills, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the last refill.

Section.Text: A practitioner may, with respect to a preparation or mixture containing a Class A precursor, prescribe it for or administer it to an individual or animal, or sell or provide it to or for an individual or for the benefit of an animal, only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the individual or animal is being treated by the practitioner in their professional capacity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the preparation or mixture is required to treat the individual’s or animal’s medical condition.

Section.Text: A practitioner who sells or provides a preparation or mixture containing a Class A precursor set out in column 1 of the schedule to an individual for self-administration or administration to an animal in a quantity that exceeds the maximum quantity, expressed as an absolute quantity or per package, specified for the contained precursor in column 2 of the schedule, may do so only if the transaction is made under a prescription and shall make a record of the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of the preparation or mixture;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person to whom the preparation or mixture was provided; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the preparation or mixture was provided.

Section.Text: A hospital that sells or provides a preparation or mixture containing a Class A precursor exclusively on a retail basis may do so subject to sections 91.92 to 91.94.

Subsection.Text: The person in charge of a hospital shall not permit a preparation or mixture containing a Class A precursor set out in column 1 of the schedule to be sold or provided to a patient or for the benefit of an animal under treatment as an in-patient or an out-patient of the hospital in a quantity, per transaction, that exceeds the maximum quantity, expressed as an absolute quantity or per package, specified for the contained precursor in column 2 of the schedule, unless the transaction is made under a prescription or another authorization of a practitioner practising in the hospital.
The person in charge of the hospital shall keep the following information or ensure that it is kept:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and quantity of the preparation or mixture provided when the prescription was filled;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the person for whom the prescription was issued;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the prescription was filled; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the number assigned to the prescription.

Section.Text: The person in charge of a hospital shall not permit a prescription for a preparation or mixture containing a Class A precursor to be refilled at the hospital unless the requirements of section 91.6 are satisfied, with any modifications that the circumstances require.

The person in charge of a hospital shall not permit a preparation or mixture containing a Class A precursor to be sold or provided pursuant to a prescription that has been transferred to the hospital, unless the requirements of subsection 91.7(2) are satisfied, with any modifications that the circumstances require.
Information to be recorded and records to be kept under this Part shall be retained for at least two years after the date the information was obtained or the record was made.

Heading.TitleText: Security Measures and Communication of Information

Section.Text: A pharmacist, practitioner or hospital that sells or provides only on a retail basis, or possesses for the purpose of sale or provision, preparations or mixtures containing Class A precursors, shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable steps to ensure the security of the Class A precursors;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on discovering an unusual waste or disappearance of a Class A precursor that cannot be explained on the basis of normally accepted business practices, notify

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a member of a police force within 24 hours after the discovery, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister, in writing, within 72 hours after making the discovery, and confirm that the notice required under subparagraph (i) has been provided;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: on discovering a theft of a Class A precursor set out in column 1 of the schedule, if the package in which it is contained is not intended for retail sale and contains a quantity of the precursor exceeding the maximum quantity specified for the precursor in column 2 of the schedule, notify the persons mentioned in subparagraphs (b)(i) and (ii) within the applicable time-periods; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: on request, provide to the Minister or make available for examination by the Minister, any information or record required to be kept or made under this Part.

Section.Text: During the year following the day these Regulations are published in the Canada Gazette, Part II, the maximum package size set out in column 2 of the schedule for the precursors listed in column 1 for items 4, 5 and 17 does not apply to the sale or provision of any of these precursors, or any preparation or mixture containing any of them, if the precursor or the preparation or mixture was produced and packaged before the day these Regulations are published in the Canada Gazette, Part II and, in respect of the sale of provision, the person who makes the sale or provision

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is deemed to conform with paragraph 5(1)(c) regardless of the package size; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: does not require an end-use declaration under section 8.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) to (4), these Regulations come into force on the later of January 1, 2003 and the expiry of 90 days after the day on which these Regulations are published in the Canada Gazette, Part II.
Subsections 6(1) and (2) and sections 7, 9, 12 to 24 and 47 come into force

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a person who produces, packages, imports or exports a Class A precursor, on the later of January 1, 2003 and the expiry of 90 days after the day on which these Regulations are published in the Canada Gazette, Part II; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a person who carries out any other activity pertaining to a Class A precursor, on July 7, 2003.

Subsection.Text: Section 8 comes into force on July 7, 2003.
Sections 55 to 82 come into force on January 1, 2004.
